intro: Banisteria dumetorum, commonly known as the "Bark Vine," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Banisteria dumetorum is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
